Review Title: Great location, clean and rather large rooms, friendly staff, good value for money. I would return.
Negative Reviews:
The breakfast was bad. Stale croissants, bacon so hard to chew, I had to spit it out. There is a pub next door with excellent breakfast at a good rate so we did not let the lousy breakfast ruin our stay. I would rather pay less and have breakfast elsewhere but the breakfast really was not good at all. Basically, we went next door to the pub, where they offer "drink as much as you like" hot drinks for 99p + cheap and made to order breakfast. We spent less than £10 for 2 people daily and we were super happy. So I think if you have just cereal for brekkie, you will be happy at the hotel but if you want bacon or croissant, go next door! 
Shower "thermostat" not working = went from set temp to scolding, to cold. That was frustrating. And painful. We did not complain, so they didn't have a chance to offer any solution. We were in room 104. 
Pillows = bricks. Some hotels let you have two pillows (as did this one) but they are different. I would much have preferred a thin and soft pillow. Note, the pillows worked well for my colleague so it was a personal note; I don't like big fat hard pillows. They were clean and fine, just not to my liking.
Positive Reviews:
It is a good budget hotel. Beds were good, room decent size. Staff friendly and helpful, foyer was clean. 
I had a parcel sent to the hotel as I had ordered something I needed to bring back home, and they handled my personal mail with utmost respect and attention. I really appreciated that. I had called in advance and been given clear instructions on how that worked. Again, excellent.

Review Title: Lovely hotel in a great location, shame about the breakfast!
Negative Reviews: Breakfast served 6:30 - 9:30 am. I'm really sorry to say that the breakfast was poor and somewhat chaotic! Hopefully, it was a one off and they were having a bad day! Went down for breakfast at 8am and struggled to find a clean table, there were plenty of tables, but none of them had been cleared from previous customers. The whole self service area is too small for the amount of people using it. The selection of food was very limited. There was a sign to say sorry no eggs today, so a full English consisted of bacon, sausage and beans. The vegetarian cooked breakfast option for my daughter consisted of just beans, the hash browns container was empty and never refilled, when asked I was told they would be out soon, but they never arrived. The fresh orange juice was so watered down it didn't taste like orange. Milk options also very limited, dairy or soya, no oat or almond for people with dairy/ soya intolerance so couldn't have a brew. Overall, very disappointing.
Positive Reviews: Lovely, clean modern room with twin beds, good size bathroom. Travelling with my daughter, we were very pleased with the room. The location of the hotel on King Street, is great, lots of places to eat and drink and a 3 minute walk from the tube station. Close to the theatre which was the reason for our visit.

Ridiculous technology in this day and age and that too in an IHG branded hotel!! Unbelievable!!!!
But since the stay was over Xmas period, parking was free. Also found the street parking around useful (9 to 6 30 PM) so parking after 630pm is free.  There are quite a few streets around that can be used to park.

Review Title: Great Staff and Accommodation,Convenient for Zones 1 & 2 Tube and Coach Station Access. Return Again
Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews:
Staff were very helpful and polite at all times

Easy to check in/out

The room was a good size, bathroom was spotless with a really powerful shower, one design fault was the sink, which looked on trend, unfortunately it was quite shallow, and almost every time you turned the tap on, the water would end up all over the place, or to avoid this, the flow was not sufficient.

We were able to leave our luggage there after we had checked out, which was great as our coach home was much later in the day

Breakfast was nice and plentiful, with quite a lot of choices, and food was nice and hot.  

Would have preferred to have my drinks served to us at the table, but no big issue.

Tables cleared promptly, can’t bear having cereal bowls left on the table, when you return with your next course

We would definitely stay here again, which is always a good sign, in fact thinking of going back in November

Review Title: Would recommend 10/10 customer service, comfy, clean, tidy, great location
Negative Reviews: N/A, we have no complaints. If i had to nitpick, the TV is a little old school, may be time for an upgrade. Otherwise, nothing negative to report.
Positive Reviews: Staff were fantastic, specifically the receptionist who welcomed us, I don't remember her name to give her a shout out (possibly beginning with an S) - The booking.com website said we could request early check in as a tick box, so I did, as we were arriving in the morning. I assumed this was automatically accepted, I unfortunately hadn't seen that i had an email denying this request, the receptionist was unaware that this was even an option but she spoke to her manager who was very lovely to let us check in early. I did say it was absolutely fine if we couldn't, we were happy to go for a mooch around the area, it's my own fault for not seeing the email from them, but as we were already there and we were polite to them, they allowed it. The room was clean, tidy, bed's were comfortable, room was the perfect temperature, easy to use shower, nice modern bathroom, anything you don't have/forget to bring the hotel can provide it for you. Location was perfect for us, a couple minutes walk from the theatre that we had tickets for (Shrek the Musical is fantastic btw), HUGE variety of shops a couple of minutes walk away, tube at the end of the street. Would reccomend, 10/10. Thank you for our stay

Review Title: The best VFM hotel for London.
Positive Reviews: Been in London 4 times before, this gem was the most value for money hotel in London. Located in Hammersmith, which is connected with three metro lines to Lodnon PLUS directly connected to Heathrow with Piccadily line. Fantastic price for a four bedroom with breakfast (for London terms) and personel very polite and helpfull. They changed every day towels which was a plus. I missed the cheese from the breakfast and coffee was not to my taste, apart from that (price wise) super. Also a very convenient neighborhood, with diners, malls, super markets, coffee shops with reduced prices compared to central London. 100% recommended for London hotel.
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Review Title: We loved the place, but it was tight in the room for a family of our size.
Negative Reviews: We only stayed the one night.  We were a family of 2 adults and 5 children.  We had 4 and 3 people over 2 rooms.  The rooms were tight and did not have alot of space.  As we said, this was perfect for the 1 night.  If it was just 2 people staying in 1 room, this would have been perfect location to stay for an number of days...
Positive Reviews: We flew from Perth Australia and arrived in London (21 hours of flight time alone).  Train to Hammersmith and we were exhausted as we walked to the hotel.  Greeted at the front door and were very happy.  Ground floor room with adjoining rooms was greatly appreciated.  The room was all set up when we arrived.  It was very clean.  Buffet breakfast was amazing.  Plenty of scambled eggs, bacon, sausages and baked beans.  Plenty of breads and all other bits.  Coffee machine and the hot chocolates that is produced was a huge hit with the with children.  Shops everywhere which was also great.
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Positive Reviews: Everything was fabulous for the entire period.The hotel is clean and the personnel was very kind and helpful.The hotel is in a nice area with a lot of stores,IKea,Lidl, Primark and Marks and Spencer nearby,calm neighborhood,close to the Hammersmith tube station and in front of bus station. For sure the negative comments comes from people that have set up their own high standard and probably cannot evaluate the quality Vs the price. The breakfast was included in the price and it was UK type: yogurt,tea,Ness cafe,milk,juice, croissants, muffins,bread,apples,musli,bacon, sausages,omelette, butter.Indeed no vegetables... probably because they are really expensive in UK...we missed indeed tomatoes, cucumber, peppers but it is not a must.The room was clean and everything day cleaned. Everything was really fantastic taking into consideration the comments we saw before our arrival.I am sure they will improve the services but we also need to see what tourists let behind!  I would also note that even if they are not offering slippers,you can ask at anytime a razor, toothpaste and toothbrush as you can see in the photo.You only need to go and ask. That you to the entire team who made from our first trip in London a fabulous one! We missed a little bit the balcony but it is not a negative point or it was not a must.Keep going you are doing a great job!
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Review Title: A comfortable hotel, well located to access London's tourist sites, staffed by a excellent team
Negative Reviews: nil
Positive Reviews:
Jasmine on reception was an absolute pleasure to deal with. She is friendly, helpful and professional. We stayed at this property 3 time over a 4 week period and each time, after the first day of our first stay, Jasmine greeted us by name with a big smile and was extremely helpful with any small requests such as printing plane boarding passes.

Rooms and restaurant staff were also good and the breakfast offer was plentiful and enjoyable.

The hotel is well located. It's about a 10 minute walk to Hammersmith and Piccadilly tube station which is serviced by both the Piccadilly and District lines. The Piccadilly line is excellent for using to access many of London's tourist sights and is the line which takes you to Heathrow airport.

The staff are extremely helpful. The rooms are perfectly serviced, with all the necessary and usual aspects, a decent shower, air conditioning and above all, a very comfortable bed.
The staff prepared the room as requested with no fuss and made our stay as hassle free as anyone could want.
The location was perfect with just a couple of minutes walk to the underground or bus services and plenty of choice for meals nearby too. The evening was also surprisingly quiet making for a good night's sleep without disturbance.
The morning breakfast was delicious with lots of hot/cold options, more than enough to start the day off well.
All in all, I will definitely be staying here again in the future. Thank you Holiday Inn, a very fine experience altogether.

Room service available. All great and we’d stay again.

Review Title: Nice visit to London; great location.  Company mgmnt of fire alarm malfunction was poor.
Negative Reviews: See the above...sorry, didn;t notice I'd have a chance to expound here.
Positive Reviews:
Access, parking, location and check-in were all excellent.  Breakfast was adequate, but seemed a bit less than fresh. 
 Morning noise from lorry traffic and nearby construction was unwelcome.  Fire alarm malfunction basically ruined one night's sleep, and was handled poorly by management.  All we received was a brief note describing the initiating event, but no explanation as to why the alarm continued to malfunction at least 4 times in the middle of the night, for at least an hour.  The next morning, word went round that refunds were only being offered to those who registered a complaint; and even then, the initial offer was only 50% refund.  The  proper way to handle this would have been a pro-active, no-questions-asked  refund for the entire evening...instead, HI mgmnt cost the company far more in goodwill than the night's revenue.

Negative Reviews:
The first room was very run down in the bathroom and noisy from outside. The second room was more pleasant but noisy from adjoining room.
Breakfast was cold the first morning but ok subsequent mornings.
I might add, at over £100 a night for the first 3 nights I expected at least a decent room. The fourth night I only paid £60 for the night and in that respect, you get what you pay for. However, at over £100 a night, I dont expect a run down bathroom with dangerous tiles on the floor or cold food.
Positive Reviews:
Room was close to the pub next door which was noisy late at night, woken at 5.40am when bin men were emptying the pubs bottles and cans, you can imagine the noise that made, on a Sunday morning too ! Bathroom floor tiles were broken and no grouting made them uneven and dangerous underfoot. I had to put towels down on the floor to protect my feet from cuts.
I had a second booking for a disability room, whilst this room was more pleasant, it was an interconnecting room and had ignorant guests being very loud late into the evening and from 5.15 the next morning. Not exactly a quiet relaxing stay.

Negative Reviews:
Room - a little tired especially bathroom decor...toilet / cistern although functioning difficult to flush. Shower tray very flimsy.
Staff response when hair dryer was reported faulty was poor at best. Initially my wife discovered this fault after getting out of the shower. The phone in the room was faulty so she walked to reception via stairwell to report the matter. The female receptionist agreed that the hairdryer did not sound healthy but said it was working. On my wifes return to the room sporting wet hair with the 'unhealthy sounding' hairdryer then completely malfunctioned. I walked to reception 3 flights as only one elevator was working and it was naturally trying to cope with the traffic capacity of two. I brought the broken hairdryer to the same female receptionist and reported the issue & the faulty phone. 
We waited 18 minutes for a replacement to arrive and when it did not arrive at our room I walked to reception again via stairwell - meanwhile my wife was sitting with wet hair. I reiterated my complaint regarding the hairdryer and a few minutes later a replacement was delivered to the room. 
We appreciate that it is a 3 star establishment but cannot fathom why the hairdryer could not be replaced when initially brought to the receptionist attention but was only addressed 20+minutes later. Although a maintenace man did try to fix the phone it remained faulty for the duration of our 3 day stay.

Review Title: Lees mijn volledig verslag dat ik eerder aan u en het hotel heb toegestuuurd.
Negative Reviews:
Ontbijt, kamer en verdwenen juwelenGood morning Mrs/Mr Robel Kahsay and Mrs Karin Sheppard Managing director Europe.
After a week of staying in your Hotel I want to inform you the following.
We are quite disappointed about the condition and the service of this/your hotel.
For  £ 1568,93 = £ 224,13 per day you get a room where you hardly can turn yourself with only one grubby chair where the other person has to sit on the bed.
The paving tiles in the bathroom are lying loose and you can only open the window when you remove one of the beds. 
The breakfast is very poor (also quality), insufficient choices (filling) and or missing croissants.
On top of it we are missing a very little square blue jewellery box were you put earrings etc. 
Inside this little box were two pair of earrings. 
One pair large white pearl hangers and one pair small round white gold ones with diamonds.
I don’t believe we forgot to take is with us but if you have found it, it would be nice of course (ROOM 338)
However we presume it has been taken away out of the small black rolling case we had with us.
(this must have taken place after 26th of May, because they were used then) 
Yes that’s what is missing also in this room: THE SAFE.
Well  there was one behind the concierge, but that was a place where everybody could get in.
Sorry to say so but never again to Holiday Inn In Hammersmith 
With regards
Frans Douqué   
+31 653 911 762
fem@douque.nl

Negative Reviews: The room, though wasn't too bad, did have a musty smell to it but we couldn't pinpoint if it was a dampness or if someone had smoked in the room. But this was passable. The breakfast was our main frustration. We visited on a peak weekend and you would think staff would expect a high turnover of guests in breakfast, however on both days of our stay, there was very little hot food available. Only sausages, bacon, & beans were being cooked. We even asked a member of staff when more hot food was coming out and the reply was "what food?"... we said "everything" and they said sausages would be 20 minutes.

Review Title: For 3 days the hotel is fine. But not more than that.
Negative Reviews:
The breakfast was quite poor. I would expect more from a Holiday Inn 3-star hotel. Mainly sausages, baked beans , scrambled eggs and bacon. There were also some yogurt, bread/croissants and a few fruits however no cheese, no turkey/chicken slices and no vegetables. The breakfast in general was quite fatty, most of the products I described above were quite unhealthy. Eventhough you are in England, the breakfast should be international.

Moreover, I found a hair in one of the two yogurt bowls and also the mug for coffee/tea were not that clean.

Another thing I didn't like was that the sockets in the rooms which were British type with no adaptors for international ones and you had to use a USB cable to charge your phone or buy an adaptor in case you want to charge your laptop.

I had to ask if there was something wrong because of the way she was speaking to me, to which she argued she had done nothing wrong. I sent a message to the hotel through this app asking them to review the cctv footage of her appalling demeanour - zero response received… 

This was before we got to the room. There were sticky marks on the surfaces and a really dirty air vent in the bathroom with a broken door handle… for the price, you’re better to stay in Chiswick or Richmond and travel a little further - honestly the worst hotel I’ve stayed in and certainly not worthy of the Holiday Inn brand.

On the first 2 days the AC was not working(It was mentioned at check in) and the room temperature was unpleasent. I was offered the option of the partial refound but did not go through with it due our busy schedule. AC issue was sorted out till the second afternoon so only one day and one night was effectively hot.
Breakfast was mediocre for my taste. The variety was poor and the quality and taste were unsatisfying compared to similar hotels in Europe(this may be the standard for UK)
The worst of all was the higene. The "clean" glasses were visibly stained with tea/coffee. I found a big peace of plastic in the omlette(it was removed by a staff member who apologised). The staff who cleans up the tables walks around with a cart with the rests of food poured in bowls and even worse, the rests of liquids(tea, coffe, orange juice) poured in something that resembles a night potty that is extremely dirty. It is an overall disgusting experience when they walk aroud with it while you are eating. I do not whant to see what the hygene is inside the kitchen! 
Another minus is the comunication. I pre-paid the stay over a month ago and requested am invoice, now, one week after check out I still do not have the invoice requested a month ago. Hollyday Inn says I need to ask Booking, Booking insists I need to ask Hollyday Inn.

We stayed at your property from 13th June to 16th June (3 nights)
The checkin was smooth but once we entered the room we got to know the AirCon system not working. Upon complain we been told its with the all hotel the system not working and there is nothing they can do till team come and the staff dont know when they come. The reception guy told is you booked through booking.com so you contact them and ask for refund and go find new hotel. My brother also staying with us in two rooms and there air con were working fine. We been provided by a fan only. This is what your customer service is. Ive asked for alternate room but flat face by the duty officer.
Adding more to our misery. Next day on 14th June while we left room for the city. We left our Night Suites ( Mine & Wife) left hung inside bathroom on the hook. When we return same evening they were not there. I mean seriouly, now our clothes are even not save in your hotel. We complain again same night but we see new faces day and night. Next day even we again complained but nothing done. We stayed three nights without aircon for which we paid in advance along we lost our clothes vanishes and asking your house keeping staff either they dont know english or showing not to. This is insane. Been a Loyal IHG customer very disappointed.

I bought food in a supermarket and left it in the room. When I returned after the room cleaning, my bottle of water and sugar disappeared. Nothing was left to replace them. Tea bags and milk were never added during 4 days of my stay.
Breakfast - poor selection, shower - moments of burning hot water.

Review Title: Will go somewhere else next time
Negative Reviews: Bring your ear plugs and own towel !   Husband couldn't sleep Friday because of the noise of the air conditioning fan running all night.  He turned it off Saturday night and we were woken almost 4 hours later at 02:35am by an alarm which only stopped when he switched the noisy fan on again.   Why does the hotel only leave one set of towels when occupied by two adults - do they expect us to share one bath towel ?   I asked for another set on Friday evening - didn't arrive.  I asked again Saturday after breakfast and was given a bath towel immediately.  My husband following instructions, left his bath towel on the floor to be replaced but by the time we returned from a day out at Hampton Court, only my towel remained in the room so we were down to 1 bath towel again.  (We passed another person walking with a set of towels from reception to his room).  We paid a lot of money for this room and it wasn't any better than a standard premier inn / travel lodge.

Review Title: If this is the standard of Holiday Inn Express today - look elsewhere.
Negative Reviews:
Upon entering the room, it was cold. 

The carpet was stained. 
The vent in the bathroom was not functioning.
There was mould in the shower area. 
 
They had used dropped ceiling tiles to cover the installation of the air conditioning system. These dropped ceiling tiles are something you would find in a commercial property such as an office block. I have never seen such an installation for a hotel room. 

Air conditioning was not operating at full capacity - hardly noticed any air conditioning activating when we set it to the maximum temperature to heat the room. 

I went to check the radiator and found that they had no working radiator attached to the wall but a small plug in radiator. The plug of this small radiator became hot quite quickly and we had to turn it off. 

The duvet provided was thin. I requested a second duvet at reception later in the evening. The night manager on duty initially tried to brush me off and told me to just turn up the heating. I had to communicate to the night manager that I was cold and I needed it. I don’t think it is an unreasonable request to be warm in a room you are staying in. We were able to obtain a second duvet approximately 30 minutes later. 

I will not forget the poor standards of Holiday Inn Express.
Positive Reviews:
Being able to check in quickly. 
That was the height of what I liked from the entire experience.

Review Title: Both the hotel and the area have seen better times. Okay if you are on a tight budget
Negative Reviews:
I can't understand many of the other reviews here. 
This hotel is tired. Old decor, tired 90's carpets and curtains. Holes in towels. Sink that didn't drain properly. 
One lift was out of operation the days we stayed.
The hotel backs directly onto train tracks (see pics for my window view. My bed was literally a few meters away from the tube line). Sound proofing is ok but you will be woken up if you have a room at the back of the hotel and you are a light sleeper.
Breakfast area and buffet does not have capacity. Signs warn guests not to attend breakfast at certain times otherwise queues form. Food available is ok but very limited in choice.
Hammersmith itself is not a very pleasant part of London. The hotel is down a side road next to a wetherspoons pub and off a high street which is fairly depressing (drunks, drugs, homeless, litter).

This is a budget hotel but is very expensive for what you get. There are better places than this. If you can choose to stay in a different part of London or you can stretch your budget a bit , I'd really recommend doing so.
Positive Reviews: Staff were very polite and reception had good capacity for check in/out. Bed was comfortable and room reasonable size for price. Generally clean enough. Budget hotel which has just the basics you need

Positive Reviews: Room was clean and excellent, staff were always polite and helpful. It was only a two night stay, but will be using this hotel again in the future.

Negative Reviews: Breakfast queue  was a bit rushed especially when you are also catering for people with children.
Positive Reviews: The front office staff were great especially  Adrian who booked us in and also checked us out. Great services all round!
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Review Title: Absolutely amazing and great value for money
Negative Reviews: Pillows were personally to hard but wouldn’t stop me from booking again
Positive Reviews: Great value for money, rooms were lovely, staff were very helpful
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Negative Reviews: Tried to check in @ 2.30pm.told cannot check in until 3pm which was ok but then reception checked someone in @ 2.40pm but still wouldn’t let various people check in until 3pm
Positive Reviews: Location and room

Negative Reviews: Room was smaller than in the picture. Air conditioning wasn’t working properly so couldn’t sleep well
Positive Reviews: Nice breakfast
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Review Title: different room was very tired next day was hoping for a better night sleep
Negative Reviews: wasn’t happy with the noise at 11.50 pm as was loud music playing and also got woken up at 6 am with the bin men emptying the glass bottles made me really jump was so loud .
Positive Reviews: it was great for near where I needed to go

Negative Reviews: showers

Review Title: didn’t quite enjoy the stay room was too hot couldn’t sleep properly
Negative Reviews: breakfast  ,couldn’t have breakfast properly cos there was big crowd and there was no staff to control them
Positive Reviews: location

Review Title: Easy location close to the tube. Breakfast was adequate. Clean  rooms
Negative Reviews: The family room for 3 had no room to open a suitcase.
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Negative Reviews: breakfast buffet: the longer you look the less you see to satisfy you. As a (broke) student i often had better food selection at my dormitory room. insufficient hygiene supplements (no earbuds, hand cream, toothburs..even hostels have those these days!). No socket adapter, none even at the reception - this happened to me first time since like 2010.
Positive Reviews: clean, spacious and comfortable room. good location. friendly staff. iron at the room.

Review Title: Ideal location for Family stay but rubbish breakfast
Negative Reviews:
The breakfast was terrible , tables left dirty , sausages were undercooked in the middle, Crossaints were stale and scrambles egg had no taste to it. 
Also we left our bags there in the left luggage.  We were given labels for our bags and a ticket as proof they were our bags. When my husband went to collect them later in the day a totally different member of staff didn't ask him for the ticket as proof that we left our bags and just told him to go in as the door was open. Not very secure as anyone could come in from the street and steal someone's luggage.
Positive Reviews: Bedrooms clean and comfy , no sound from surrounding area and air con worked which was lovely when it was warm all day. Good access to tube lines and bit out of town so ideal away from the hussle and bussle of the city centre. Nice little high street with shops for food and drinks.
Room Type: Standard Double Room with Sofa Bed

Negative Reviews: Mattress has a big dip in it. Very uncomfortable to sleep in. The shower was scalding hot and then freezing cold. The tiles had gaps in them. Difficult to get the right temperature In The room. There was a flickering light which meant I had to keep the light off as it could trigger a migraine.  No water in the taps at 11 a m  even though checkout was confirmed to be at 12.
Positive Reviews: Staff were friendly. Reasonable location. Quiet.
